intro: Raphionacme elsana, commonly known as the silverleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by fluffy white seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Its leaves are typically silver-gray in color, covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid environments. Raphionacme elsana is often found in rocky soils and dry habitats, making it well adapted to semi-desert conditions.
